conclusion: Need to find the time during which there's an induced current in the frame.
Frame is square with side length l, moving at speed v, magnetic field width d, with l < d.
Imagining a square frame moving from left to right through a magnetic field.
Understanding the physical situation: frame moving through magnetic field causes induced emf.
Induced emf occurs when there's a change in magnetic flux through the frame.
Magnetic flux φ is given by φ = B · A · cos θ.
Assuming field is perpendicular to frame, so φ = B · A.
Induced emf occurs when φ is changing, need to find time interval of changing flux.
Frame is smaller than magnetic field region, l < d.
Induced current is present from entering to exiting the field.
Time to enter field is t_enter = l/v.
Time to exit field is t_exit = l/v.
Total time with induced current t_total = 2l/v.
Double-checking reasoning by considering frame position relative to field boundaries.
Frame starts entering field at t = 0.
Frame fully enters field at t1 = l/v.
Frame starts exiting field at t2 = d/v.
Frame fully exits field at t3 = (d + l)/v.
